💰 Copper prices nudges $11,000 per tonne
🔌 Copper vital for telecoms, power generation and renewables
🪢 IEA predicts only 80% of copper demand will be met by 2030

Copper prices have hit new highs over the past month as demand for the metal grows and experts predict a shortage in years to come.

Copper is a key material in sectors including telecoms, power generation, and construction. Copper is used in wiring for broadband networks and for transformers and generators in the power production industry. 

The transition to renewable energy has further amplified copper demand. The @internationalenergyagency estimates that each megawatt of wind and solar energy consumes between 3 and 5 metric tonnes of copper.

Electric vehicles also drive copper demand, using approximately 83kg of copper per vehicle compared with 23kg for traditional cars.

Recycling accounts for 35% of copper supply, but it’s insufficient to meet booming demand. 

The IEA warns that by 2030, only 80% of copper demand will be met, ensuring high prices persist as industries expand and push for sustainable energy solutions.

Bengaluru-based electric scooter maker Ola Electric has received approval from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for its initial public offering (IPO). 

The Bhavish Aggarwal-led EV giant filed its DRHP with SEBI on December 2, proposing to raise up to Rs 5,500 crore through a fresh issue of shares. 

Additionally, the IPO includes an offer-for-sale (OFS) component of 95.2 million shares.

The DRHP outlines that Ola Electric’s promoter, Bhavish Aggarwal, will offload 47 million shares, representing half of the total OFS. 

Ola Electric plans to allocate a portion of the IPO proceeds towards repaying loans owed by its subsidiaries to Axis Bank and Bank of Baroda. 

Furthermore, significant funds will be directed towards expanding its electric vehicle portfolio and increasing the capacity of its gigafactory, a large-scale manufacturing facility dedicated to EV production.

Reading Pesan Bus Listrik Alexander Dennis Enviro400EV

Alexander Dennis, mengumumkan pemesanan dari operator bus Inggris Reading Buses untuk 53 bus, Selasa (11/6/24). Pemesanan itu terdiri dari 24 bus tanpa emisi Enviro400EV dan 29 bus rendah emisi (21 bus Enviro400 dan delapan bus Enviro200). Pemesanan ini dilakukan setelah Reading Borough Council mendapatkan dana Zero-Emission Regional Bus Areas (ZEBRA 2) putaran kedua dari pemerintah Inggris.

“Kami telah melakukan pengujian ekstensif demonstrasi dari sejumlah pemasok. Dua hal yang paling penting adalah pengalaman pelanggan dan pengalaman pengemudi kami, sebelum kami mempertimbangkan sisi teknisnya. Dari semua demonstrasi, Alexander Dennis Enviro400EV baru memiliki tata letak terbaik untuk pelanggan, dan pengemudi yang mengujinya sangat terkesan,” ujar Chief Executive Officer Reading Buses, Robert Williams menyebutkan alasan pilihan perusahaannya.

Bus-bus baru Reading ini akan menghilangkan emisi gas buang lokal dari rute sibuk Reading Buses 17 dan 21 saat mulai beroperasi pada 2025. Reading Depo juga akan dilengkapi dengan 13 fast charger yang masing-masing dapat mengisi daya dua kendaraan sekaligus. 

Di sisi lain, Alexander Dennis Enviro400EV dengan Voith Electrical Drive System (VEDS) dan baterai berkinerja tinggi menyimpan energi hingga 472kWh, telah teruji sebagai bus tingkat listrik paling hemat energi. 

“Enviro400EV next generation akan memberikan Reading Buses awal yang baik dalam teknologi tanpa emisi, efisiensi energi terdepan di kelasnya, dan keluaran energi yang dapat dijamin memastikan bahwa bus ini akan lebih hemat biaya pengoperasiannya dan bisa beroperasi lebih lama,” kata Regional Sales Manager Alexander Dennis, Mark Taylor.

Ford Ends Costly EV Dealership Program 🚗🔋

Ford Motor is ending its "EV-certified" dealership program, which required store owners to invest up to $1 million to sell electric vehicles (EVs).

Initial Hype and Reality Check
Announced in September 2022 by Ford CEO Jim Farley, the program aimed to capitalize on high demand for EVs. However, the expected surge in EV sales has not materialized. 

Slower Growth in EV Sales
Sales of EVs for Ford and other automakers are increasing, but much slower than anticipated. This has led many companies to delay or cancel their future EV plans. 

Changes in Strategy
Marin Gjaja, COO of Ford's Model E electric vehicle business, noted, "The world has changed. The growth has slowed down." Due to these market changes and feedback from dealers, the "Model e Dealership Program" is ending. 

Opening EV Sales to All Dealers
Ford will now allow all of its dealers to sell EVs, aiming to boost sales. Dealers will still need to invest in charging infrastructure and training, but the required amounts will be significantly lower than before. 

Reduced Investment Requirements
Initial investment estimates were between $500,000 and $1.2 million, but dealers who joined the full program spent about $600,000 on average. The new requirements will be less demanding financially.

Steffen Reiche Jadi Board Member Volkswagen Commercial Vehicles 

Volkswagen Group mengumumkan Board Member baru untuk Volkswagen Commercial Vehicles (VWCV) yang bertanggung jawab pada Produksi dan Logistik, Jumat (14/6/24). Steffen Reiche menggantikan Josef Baumert dan akan bertugas secara efektif mulai 1 Agustus 2024. 

"Kami sangat menantikan Steffen Reiche bergabung dengan tim Management Board kami. Saya tidak dapat membayangkan waktu yang lebih baik untuk menyerahkan tongkat estafet. Bersama Poznań, Września dan Hanover, kami memiliki tiga pabrik modern untuk produk unggulan dengan kualitas terbaik,” kata Chairman Management Board VWCV, Carsten Intra. 

Menurut Intra, permulaan produksi penting dan konversi produksi di Hanover ke mode produksi tunggal yang telah disiapkan. Begitu juga strategi masa depan VWCV yang juga sudah siap untuk memberikan dorongan penting bagi transformasi dan masa depan produksi-logistik VWCV. “Terima kasih saya sampaikan kepada Josef Baumert atas komitmennya yang tak kenal lelah dan besar terhadap VWCV dan hampir 30 tahun pengabdiannya kepada Grup," katanya lagi.

Steffen Reiche bekerja di Grup Volkswagen selama hampir 30 tahun dan memegang berbagai posisi manajemen internasional. Reiche saat ini menjabat sebagai Board Management Member for Production & Product Management di perusahaan patungan SAIC Volkswagen di China. Sebelumnya, pernah menjabat sebagai CEO dan Presiden Volkswagen de México 2018-2021 dan bertanggung jawab atas produksi di seluruh wilayah Amerika Utara. 

Jabatan lainnya di Grup Volkswagen termasuk Head of Plant Management merek SEAT, di Martorell, Spanyol. Pernah juga menjadi Lead of Production Management Volkswagen di Bratislava, Slovakia, dan juga Head of Brand Planning di Volkswagen AG.

Where We Have Come From⁠
⁠
Over the last decade, battery technology has seen remarkable advancements, particularly in the electric vehicle (EV) industry. The introduction of lithium-ion batteries, with higher energy density and improved longevity, has significantly extended EV ranges. These high-performance batteries are more efficient and have reduced charging times, making EVs a more viable option for everyday use. In addition to this, advancements in battery management systems have improved reliability by monitoring cell voltage and temperature to prevent thermal runaway and optimise performance.⁠
⁠
The Developments We Have Witnessed⁠
⁠
The rapid development of powerful solid-state batteries holds promise for further enhancing EV capabilities in the near future. These advanced batteries offer increased energy density, faster charging times, and enhanced safety features compared to traditional lithium-ion cells. With ongoing research focusing on reducing costs and increasing energy storage capacity, we can expect even greater improvements in battery technology that will continue to revolutionise the automotive industry and accelerate the shift towards sustainable transportation solutions.⁠
⁠
This all translates into longer range and faster charging times for electric vehicles (EVs), making them more convenient and practical for daily use.⁠
⁠
What Does the Future Hold?⁠
⁠
So what is considered as possible? As battery technology evolves, we can expect to see a notable increase in EV range, potentially reaching well over 500 miles on a single charge. These sorts of improvements were considered to be la-la land only a couple of decades ago but now it is considered highly deliverable. This extended range will not only alleviate range anxiety among consumers but also drive further adoption of EVs as a mainstream mode of transportation. Additionally, advancements in battery reliability will enhance durability and safety features, ensuring a smoother and more dependable driving experience for EV owners.⁠
⁠
Let’s see what the next few years deliver in terms of technological change.⁠

💥 🚗 Charging Station Insights You Should Know 🚗 💥 
 
Here are some common questions answered to help you get the most out of your EV charging experience:
 
Common Questions:
❓ Is the charging connector always live?
No, the charging connector is not live until it is properly connected and authenticated with the vehicle. Only then does it start supplying power.
 
❓ What if the charging station malfunctions?
Charging stations are equipped with several safety features:
 
📍Signal Guidance Function: Ensures the connection is stable before starting the charge. If the signal changes during charging, the output will be cut off within 80 milliseconds.
📍Dual Switch Mechanism: This physically isolates the charging circuit when not in use, enhancing safety.
❓ What should I do if charging fails to start?
If you can't start charging, ensure the vehicle is turned off (some models may need to be locked). Make sure the charging connector is securely connected and you hear the locking click. If issues persist, contact customer service for assistance.
 
❓ Does the current vary for different vehicles?
The output voltage and current of the charging station is based on the feedback from the vehicle's battery management system (BMS), and the charging station itself is not able to freely output voltage and current to the vehicle.
❓ Does frequent fast charging damage the battery?
During fast charging with a DC charger, the charging speed is fastest when the battery is between 20% and 80%. Above 90%, the charging power will be reduced accordingly. This reduction is set by the vehicle manufacturer to protect the battery and prevent damage. However, when charging between 95% and 100%, some virtual power may be produced.

We've had our '23 ID.4 Pro S AWD for six months, and it has convinced me that EVs are just better everyday vehicles, period. Ideally, I'll never buy another ICE daily driver again. 

Yes, we have the ideal situation with solar, battery backup and an L2 charger at home. I get why an EV may not work for everyone's personal situation. But for us, it does, and it's great.

I love that we never visit a gas station, the "fuel" is less expensive (or free, in our case ☀️), torque is instant, it's super smooth and quiet so I'm more relaxed while driving and don't get as tired on long drives, the handling is surprisingly good with all the weight of the battery pack down low, on hot days the car doesn't generate extra heat, and on cold days the heater works instantly (don't have to wait for an engine to warm), there's essentially zero maintenance other than consumables like tires/wiper blades, and the list goes on. It's just...better.

I'm still a hardcore "car guy" and will likely always have an ICE "fun" vehicle, but I'm loving the EV life and am excited about the innovation in this space, with really cool products coming out constantly. We will soon be a two EV family (plus the Miata and maybe something else :) )
